Sick and tired!!!

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

â05-31-2015 03:40 PM

I first tip the scales with pre-diabetes and then I was told my numbers were 7 and 7.3. Im only 36 and I don't plan to let diabetes control my life. I started back running and walking three miles. I love to eat junk I cant help it. Im also the youngest women to go through menopause. Im 36 and menopause has started already. My endocrine system has really done a number on me. Im tired, angry and  just plain over diabetes. I take metformin 500mg a day. Can't take 1000mg cause it makes me sick to my stomach. The 500mg works just fine along with me running on the treadmill, jump squats, walking, lifting weights and working with my fitness trainer.

Since diabetes wants to attack me, Ill just fight back!!!!!

Helpful Response Given! Go to this response.

I wrote this to help you begin taking control: Getting Started

 

What country are you in? Were those numbers fasting (before breakfast) or at another time of day?

Cheers, Alan, Type 2, d&e metformin 2000mg, Australia.

There is nothing I could eat I like more than my eyes.

â06-01-2015 08:29 AM

I'm pretty new to diabetes myself, but I've run into some information that claims sometimes thyroid issues can cause insulin resistance, which in turn causes T2 diabetes. Sorry that I don't have any studies to cite for you or even any websites, but it might be worth it for you to check into that possible connection.  Maybe, if your thryoid issues are handled, the diabetes might be a bit easier for you to control.

 

Rainy

Rainy

1985 glucose intolerance test slightly abnormal; advised to avoid sweets
3/2015 Dxd Pre-diabetes - began low carb diet, frequent testing at home, strength-building exercises, walking DVDs
7/2015 Dx T2 diabetes, although no one told me. It was in my medical record.
2.2015 A1C 6.2................ 5.2015 A1C 5.9.........9.2015 A1C 5.8
9.2015 Glucophage ER 1000mg after evening meal
*Our bodies are fearfully, wonderfully, UNIQUELY made - and we are made to move. What works for me today may not work tomorrow, and your mileage is almost certainly going to be different from mine.
*I share my own experiences with the hope they may help someone else; it is not my intention to push my story on anyone.
*I am not a medical professional of any kind, I just have a lot of opinions and a lot of words.

â06-03-2015 03:29 PM

nikkib60619 wrote:

I first tip the scales with pre-diabetes and then I was told my numbers were 7 and 7.3.

 

Im only 36 and I don't plan to let diabetes control my life.

 

I started back running and walking three miles. I love to eat junk I cant help it.

 

Im also the youngest women to go through menopause. Im 36 and menopause has started already. My endocrine system has really done a number on me.

 

Im tired, angry and  just plain over diabetes. I take metformin 500mg a day. Can't take 1000mg cause it makes me sick to my stomach. The 500mg works just fine along with me running on the treadmill, jump squats, walking, lifting weights and working with my fitness trainer.

 

Since diabetes wants to attack me, Ill just fight back!!!!!

Hi, @nikkib60619  and welcome to the site!  Sorry it's taken me a couple of days to find your thread...

 

 

I'm curious--when were you diagnosed?

 

I hope that along with all that exercise you're doing (which is a great idea, btw--kudos!) you're also cutting back on junk food. You probably don't need to cut all of it out, 100%, but most junk food is pretty carby, and eating too many carbs will almost certainly make it hard to control your BG (esp at first) in spite of exercise and meds.

 

 

BTW, your participation on this site will probably be esp welcomed by @amcyki  She's fairly new also and recently started a thread asking for comments from T2s who are under 40 years old. In case you want to check that thread out....

http://community.diabetes.org/t5/Adults-Living-with-Type-2/Are-There-Many-quot-Younger-quot-Type-2-s...

 

Till next time,
Mary
aka maryd98
-----------------------------------
Diagnosed T2 July 1998
First A1C (July 1998): 13.6
First BG (July 1998): 537
Latest A1C (July 2015): 5.4
On oral meds for about 9 months after diagnosis
"Just" diet and exercise since quitting oral meds

â06-13-2015 05:52 PM

Nikki,

I'm 33 and was diagnosed at 31. I hear you on the Metformin. That stuff is no fun! I'm transitioning to get off of it again. Junk food is also difficult for me. I hate when my friends talk about how delicious their yummy carby food is in front of me. I'm currently losing weight. I know it's passive agressive, but I'm skinnier (at upper level of normal weight) than my junk food addict friends because of my low carb diet, so I was thinking of bragging about my pant size the next time they bring up how delicious their food is. I probably won't actually do it bc I don't want to be an a**hole, but I probably should use my pant size as incentive to not get too upset at my friends when they do this and I'm feeling left out.

 

I've also been thinking about how much better I like my eyes and feet than I like food. Especially bc I love to get out and hike and look at the beautiful scenery. This is a big motivation for me. It would be absolutely devastating to be in a wheelchair or not be able to navigate with my vision. I love that someone on here has that they like their eyes more than food in their signature. It's something I consider.

 

Diabetes is tough and frustrating. But when I'm eating right and exercising, my moods are much better! I also have to say, this board has already been helpful in the short time I've been participating again. I discovered the bedtime peanut butter trick here to prevent such high liver dumps. My fasting BS is going down significantly with this trick so far. (This morning is the first morning I've been below 100 in a very long time!)

 

Anyway, good work on fighting this thing! PM me if you ever need to vent about the diabetes or just need support in working on the numbers.

 

 

Amcy
____________________
Diagnosed with a 10.5 A1C Fall of 2012 at 30 years
Latest A1C 6.3
Original Diagnosis of Type 2
Sept 2015: New Diagnosis of Type 1

â06-14-2015 09:41 AM

 my morning highs are 221 and I always wondered why. I try not to eat after 7pm. So I started doing late night exercises and that got it down to 150 which is still to high for morning levels.

When I first noticed the change in my bathroom habits I knew something was wrong. I caught diabetes early on when my A1c was 6.4. I ignored it of course and my A1c jumped to 7!!

My highest A1C is 8! i kicked up the Cardio to 45 minutes!! Now I see the light. Exercise drops my levels very quicklly!

 

When I was going to the gym on a regular basis, I had no problems with my glucose levels. I stop going for nine months and my A1C kept rising(go Figure)

IF People WANT TO KNOW does exercise work, YES IT DOES!!!!!!!!!

â06-14-2015 11:22 AM

nikkib60619 wrote:

 my morning highs are 221 and I always wondered why. I try not to eat after 7pm. So I started doing late night exercises and that got it down to 150 which is still to high for morning levels.

When I first noticed the change in my bathroom habits I knew something was wrong. I caught diabetes early on when my A1c was 6.4. I ignored it of course and my A1c jumped to 7!!

My highest A1C is 8! i kicked up the Cardio to 45 minutes!! Now I see the light. Exercise drops my levels very quicklly!

 

When I was going to the gym on a regular basis, I had no problems with my glucose levels. I stop going for nine months and my A1C kept rising(go Figure)

IF People WANT TO KNOW does exercise work, YES IT DOES!!!!!!!!!

Just wanted to add that exercise is great but a low-carb diet is the most important tool you have.

 Those low readings you see after exercise are great but measure 1 hour later and you will see that the BG goes back up even if you don't eat anything.

You can NOT out exercise bad eating, the eating will win every time.

 

 

 

T2 Diagnosed MAR 2013 - BG - 242
No meds - diet and exercise only
Currently on Ketogenic diet
More info about the Keto diet
Last A1C 6.1 12/2014

â06-14-2015 05:57 PM - edited â06-14-2015 05:57 PM

I'm aware getting off the junk foods is difficult, but it must be done if you want to avoid complications.

 

Don't look at it as a problem.  Look at it a challenge.  Challenge yourself to stop eating junk food.  If you posted for a challenger, you might meet someone with the same goal and then challenge one another.

 

There's no such thing as a problem, only challenges.

 

Lyndol

Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow is a mystery. Today is a gift. That's why we call it the present. Author Unknown.
"True happiness is ... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future."-- Seneca,
Roman philosopher and playwright
T2 since 1-2013
A1C 6.4 8-2012
6.0 1-2013
6.0 7-2013
6.4 12-2013 :-(
5.9 11-2014 :-)
A1C 5.9 5-2015
Hypertension
Coronary Artery Disease
Low T testosterone injectable 100 mg IM every other week
Lisinopril 2.5 mg daily
Lantus 15 units at bedtime
